OurPaths Privacy Policy

Effective January 1, 2015

We respect your privacy and have created a number of processes and safeguards to protect the security of the personal information you provide to us. We want to share with you how we collect and store this information, how we use it, and under what circumstances we could be compelled to disclose it. We encourage you to read the entire Terms of Use policy that governs the OurPaths Application (the "Application"), of which this is a section.

Information We Collect And Store


OurPaths is committed to protecting the privacy and security of the personal information you provide to us. Although you may visit the Application without telling us who you are or revealing any information about yourself, most visitors choose to register.


Those sections of the Application (including restricted portions) that request submission of personal information (referred to for convenience as "Registration Pages") contain a function for collecting various pieces of your personal information including, but not limited to, name, address, email address, phone number(s) and credit card or account information.

When you register, you will be asked to provide some personal information that allows you to become a Member. You have the right to withhold some of the requested information or to change information in your account settings at any time. We only collect your personal information if you voluntarily submit the information to us.

Through certain technologies employed by this Application, however, we also collect non-personally identifiable information about you. For more details about this type of data collection, please refer to the section below on cookies.

To protect your security and privacy, we require that you (as opposed to a third party on your behalf) enter the personal information that we collect and that the information be current. However, we disclaim any legal duty to verify the accuracy of any personal data that you provide to OurPaths.

You are free to access the personal information we have on file by contacting our Customer Service department by email at support@ourpaths.com. In addition, at any time you can request that we modify or delete your personal information by sending an email to us at support@ourpaths.com with the words “UPDATE MY INFORMATION” in the subject line. In order to protect your security and privacy, OurPaths may take reasonable steps to verify your identity prior to making changes to your personal information.

What do we use your information for?

The information we collect from you is primarily used to process transactions, personalize your experience on the Application and allow you to create a personalized memorial. We reserve the right, however, to compile, save, use within the scope of our activities, and analyze any and all data that you provide to us or place on the Application throughout the Application.

We use the personal information about you that you provide to us for our internal purposes such as responding to your requests for information or materials, contacting you, conducting internal analyses such as surveys and market research, processing and completing orders, processing your payment, administering your account, and administering and developing our business relationship with you or the company you represent. We also use your personal information to communicate with you, such as, for example, to provide you with administrative communications regarding your account or information relating to products, offers, or programs on the Application that may be of interest to you.

We do not sell mailing lists or personal information. We do not disclose your personal information to third parties unless (1) you consent to that sharing or (2) we are sharing that information with trusted companies – our vendors – who are contractually bound to use personal information that we share with them only to perform the services we have hired them to provide. These companies provide services such as fulfilling orders you submit, maintaining quality control or collecting and processing information. Others may collect and use personal information you provide to us or place on the Application to better understand the offers, promotions, and types of advertising that are most appealing to our customers. After the information is collected by these third parties, it is aggregated so it is not personally identifiable or tied to you or any other user. If you would prefer that these companies not collect your information, please email us at support@ourpaths.com.

We also may share your personal information in the event that our business is transferred to another entity by way of merger, sale of the company’s assets, or otherwise. If you consent to the sharing of your personal information, we may share your information with OurPaths-related entities and selected third parties so that they may provide you with or contact you regarding information and materials that may be of interest to you. Please refer to the section below regarding opting In and out.

We may also collect and group demographic and preferences information, responses to surveys and other personal information that we collect from you and any content you place on the Application into an aggregate, non-personally identifiable form for disclosure to our existing or potential business partners, affiliates, sponsors or other third parties. However, please be assured that this aggregate data will in no way personally identify you or any other visitors to the Application.

From time to time, we may collect general, non-personal, statistical information about the use of the Application, such as how many visitors visit a specific page, how long they stay on that page and which hyperlinks, if any, they “click” on. We collect this information through the use of “cookies” and other tracking technologies, which are discussed in greater detail below in the section on cookies and web beacons. We collect this information in order to determine which areas of the Application are most popular and to enhance the Application for visitors. As with other aggregated data, we may disclose such data to our existing or potential business partners, affiliates, sponsors or other third parties, but this aggregate data will in no way personally identify you or any other visitors to the Application.

Finally, in rare circumstances we also may release your information when we reasonably believe release it is necessary to comply with the law, enforce our Terms of Use policies, or protect our or others’ rights, property or safety.

How do we protect your information?

OurPaths is committed to safeguarding information concerning and submitted by users like you. We implement a variety of security measures to maintain the safety of your personal information when you enter, submit, or access your personal information.

We offer the use of a secure server. All supplied sensitive/credit information is transmitted via Secure Socket Layer (SSL) technology and then encrypted into our database to be accessed only by those authorized with special access rights to our systems and who are required to keep the information confidential. After a transaction, your private information will not be stored on our servers.

Despite the security measures employed by OurPaths, you should be aware that it is impossible to guarantee absolute security with respect to information sent though the Internet.

OurPaths will, to the extent possible, control your personal information and, except as otherwise set forth in this Privacy policy, we will not disclose your information to third parties. Although we are committed to maintaining the confidentiality of your personal information and the content you place in any private room, we reserve the right to disclose such information without first obtaining your consent if we reasonably believe we are required by law to do so.

Do we use cookies or web beacons?

Yes. We use cookies to understand and save your preferences for future visits. Cookies are small files that enable us to recognize you and remember certain preferences and other information.

Please be aware that linked third-party websites may also use cookies. We cannot control the use of cookies by these third-party websites. For example, when you link from this Website to a third-party website, that website may have the ability to recognize that you have come from our Application by using cookies. If you have any questions about how third-party websites use cookies, you should contact such third parties directly.

We may also employ software technology known as “web beacons” or “clear GIFs,” which helps us keep track of what content on our Application is effective. Web beacons are small graphics with a unique identifier that are used to track the online movements of Internet users. Web beacons are embedded in the web pages you review, so they are not stored on your hard drive. The web beacons we use do not track or collect any personally identifiable information about you and they are in no way linked to your personally identifiable information.

Opting in and out

When you submit personal information to us when you register, you may be given an opportunity to opt in to receiving additional information from OurPaths, its related entities and/or selected third parties. If you opt in, you may be added to our list of users who will receive promotional and marketing communications. If you initially opt in to receiving such communications and you later decide that you no longer want to receive them, you may opt out of receiving promotional and marketing communications from us and/or our partners and other third parties by emailing us at support@ourpaths.com.

Third-party links

For your convenience, OurPaths may include or offer third party products or services on our Application whose information practices may be different than ours. These third party sites have separate and independent privacy policies. We therefore have no control over and disclaim any responsibility or liability for the content and activities of these linked sites. Nonetheless, we seek to protect the integrity of our Application and welcome any feedback about these sites.

Personalized URL links

On occasion, we may personalize and customize our Application for certain users. Invitations to visit these customized pages generally will be sent to you via an email containing a personalized URL, a notice on a registration page or in response to you logging on to a certain portion of this Application. If you are invited to visit one of these sites, you may find it customized with references to products and/or services that we believe may be of interest to you based on your previous interactions with OurPaths and on information you have provided to us. While you are visiting this customized site, we may collect tracking or other non-personally identifiable information about your visit to better tailor the site to your interests. If you do not want your information to be collected in this way, please do not accept the invitation to visit these sites.

Children’s Online Privacy Protection Act compliance

We are in compliance with the requirements of COPPA (Children’s Online Privacy Protection Act). We do not knowingly collect information from anyone under 13 years of age. Our Application, products and services are all directed to people who are at least 13 years old or older. Our Terms of Use specifically prohibit anyone under 13 years of age from creating a memorial.

Online privacy policy only

This online privacy policy applies only to information collected through our Application and not to information collected offline.

Your consent

By using our site, you consent to our Privacy Policy and other Terms of Use.

Changes to our privacy policy

We reserve the right to change this Privacy Policy at any time. It is our policy to post a notice of any changes to this Privacy Policy for a period of thirty (30) days following any such modifications. It is also our policy to notify Members through email of any change. Please regularly review this Privacy Policy regularly if you are concerned about any potential changes. Your continued use of this Website subsequent to OurPaths’ 30-day notice of modification of shall constitute your acceptance of the modified Privacy Policy.

If any term or provision of this Privacy Policy shall be found to be invalid, illegal or otherwise unenforceable, such finding shall not affect the other terms or provisions of this Privacy Policy, or the whole of this Privacy Policy, but such term or provision shall be deemed modified to the extent necessary to render such term or provision enforceable, and the rights and obligations of you and OurPaths shall be construed and enforced accordingly, preserving to the fullest permissible extent the intent and agreements set forth in this Privacy Policy.

Contacting us

If you have any questions regarding this Privacy Policy, please contact us at support@ourpaths.com.
